author: ukjaybrat
title: Comment on Recapping the four-day weekend (Monday Show Thread) by ukjaybrat
text:
Kentucky Sports Radio University of Kentucky Basketball, Football, and Recruiting news brought to you in the most ridiculous manner possible. Browse: Home / Main / Recapping the four-day weekend (Monday Show Thread) Posted in Main | 10 Responses (@KentuckyMBB) 
Got a case of the Mondays? We all do after that four-day weekend. Now it’s time to get back on the grind and it starts by tuning in to Kentucky Sports Radio radio. 
Listen in as Matt Jones and Ryan Lemond recap the Big Blue weekend and look ahead to Mississippi State. They’ll talk Auburn, Madness, recruiting, Kings-Pels and Mississippi State. 
Join in on the fun by calling (502) 571-1080. 
PRTC TV Channels 209 & 409: Jackson & Owlsey Counties (Replayed at 1 and 6) 
On Delay (ALL TIMES LISTED EASTERN)… 
WVHI (1330am): Evansville, IN, 5-7pm WMTL (870am): Leitchfield, 11am-1pm WRIL (106.3fm): Middlesboro, Thur 8-10pm WWTF (1580am): Lexington, 4-6pm Article written by Drew Franklin I can recite every line from Forrest Gump, blindfolded. Follow me on Twitter: @DrewFranklinKSR 10 responses to “Recapping the four-day weekend (Monday Show Thread)” UK_JB October 19, 2015 at 9:58 am | Permalink | Reply 
Pretty awesome watching Big Blue Madness! Awesome UK weekend too! 
I noticed the new LED ribbon wraps. I like that. So is bertha going to be gone now? ukjaybrat October 19, 2015 at 10:27 am | Permalink 
bertha has one more year. we’ll get the replacement scoreboard next season (is what i heard) hater October 19, 2015 at 10:13 am | Permalink | Reply 
It is football season. bigbluecoop October 19, 2015 at 10:26 am | Permalink | Reply 
When I signed up for Direct Deposit I still got a check stub that I could hold in my hands and the money was in my account at 12:01 am on payday. ukjaybrat October 19, 2015 at 10:28 am | Permalink 
Direct deposit is better because I never have to go to the bank CATandMONKEY October 19, 2015 at 10:37 am | Permalink | Reply 
Dip is nasty. Amen. Signed, first three times dip n puke. Never again. hater October 19, 2015 at 10:39 am | Permalink | Reply 
My favorite player by just a smidgen is Kyle Macy. Second is Kenny Walker. Laker Cat 18 October 19, 2015 at 10:41 am | Permalink | Reply 
It’s came to show that we do not play as well at home as we do on the road. It’s just how it goes. I do not think our best chance to win is at home at this point. Richard Head October 19, 2015 at 10:44 am | Permalink 
Now that is a ridiculous statement. CATandMONKEY October 19, 2015 at 10:43 am | Permalink | Reply 
Davis. I saw his reaction live, immediately after the UNC win. Competitor. Point. Blank. Period. Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
